snippet: Ted Cruz has managed to alienate and agitate most of his Republican colleagues, but he has used his role as an outsider as a source of strength in his presidential campaign.
abstract: Congressional Memo; many Republicans in Congress are loathe to speak openly about their dislike for Sen Ted Cruz, who has managed to alienate and anger many of his colleagues in Senate since arriving in 2013; Cruz has used his unpopularity in Congress as plus in his presidential campaign, and his colleagues fear that criticizing him will help boost his standing among voters, or be used against them in their own re-election efforts.
lead_paragraph: Ted Cruz has managed to alienate and agitate most of his Republican colleagues, but he has used his role as an outsider as a source of strength in his presidential campaign.

headline.print_headline: Cruz’s Unpopularity Is Taken as a Strength
headline.main: Ted Cruz, Shunned in the Senate, Plays Unpopularity to His Advantage
